challenge.title: Step 52
challenge.description: Now, combine your raw string with an f-string and interpolate your symbols variable inside the character class. Remember that you can interpolate a variable within an f-string using curly brackets { }.

tests.text: The second item in your fourth constraint tuple should be the string fr'[{symbols}]'.

challengeFiles.name: main
challengeFiles.contents:
import re
import secrets
import string


def generate_password(length, nums, special_chars, uppercase, lowercase):
    # Define the possible characters for the password
    letters = string.ascii_letters
    digits = string.digits
    symbols = string.punctuation

    # Combine all characters
    all_characters = letters + digits + symbols

    while True:
        password = ''
        # Generate password
        for _ in range(length):
            password += secrets.choice(all_characters)
        
        constraints = [
            (nums, r'\d'),
            (lowercase, r'[a-z]'),
            (uppercase, r'[A-Z]'),
            (special_chars, r'\W')
        ]        

    return password

challengeFiles.name: main
challengeFiles.contents:
import re
import secrets
import string


def generate_password(length=16, nums=1, special_chars=1, uppercase=1, lowercase=1):

    # Define the possible characters for the password
    letters = string.ascii_letters
    digits = string.digits
    symbols = string.punctuation

    # Combine all characters
    all_characters = letters + digits + symbols

    while True:
        password = ''
        # Generate password
        for _ in range(length):
            password += secrets.choice(all_characters)
        
        constraints = [
            (nums, r'\d'),
            (special_chars, fr'[{symbols}]'),
            (uppercase, r'[A-Z]'),
            (lowercase, r'[a-z]')
        ]

        # Check constraints
        if all(
            constraint <= len(re.findall(pattern, password))
            for constraint, pattern in constraints
        ):            
            break
    
    return password
    

if __name__ == '__main__':
    new_password = generate_password()
    print('Generated password:', new_password)
